title: Thunderbird is horribly slow
content:
At some point after one of the recent major updates, Thunderbird has become horribly slow. In particular, filters and searches. After typing the first character, the program becomes unresponsive for 6-10 seconds, and this continues this behavior after typing each character. At the same time, the screen will compress to the left, and then go back to normal size. The application becomes unresponsive, but there is no category in the performance monitor that is at 100% (CPU, RAM, SSD, Network, GPU). Thunderbird doesn't use more than about 20% of CPU capacity, and I have 24GB of RAM free, but still becomes unresponsive.

Do you have any suggestions?

My computer has NVME SSDs and 32GB of ram, so I don't think it should be a performance issue. I am running Windows 10 Pro.

Thanks
creator: hijohnperez

title: Forwarding messages using the S/MIME protocol in 128.6.0esr
content:
Good morning, I would like to report an issue with version 128.6.0esr of Mozilla Thunderbird. Since updating to the latest version, there has been a problem with forwarding messages encrypted using the S/MIME protocol and signed by the internal certification authority. The issue occurs when: the message is signed and encrypted, as well as when the message is only signed(without encryption). Is this issue related to security measures or is it a bug? Please provide a quick response and verify this functionality. Yours sincerely,

Mariusz

title: one folder re-indexing
content: hello, most probably we went way over what's supposed to be as regards thunderbird folders. one of these folders (with some 5,7 Gb content) finally sort of lost all its subfolders, sub-subfolders and emails. the files are there on the disk, but Thunderbird can't see them anymore. I tried to fix it with the available button, but after 8 hours it was still stuck at the very first step (don't know if there are more, really). also I searched online and found some interesting solutions, among which ne pointed at removing the panacea.dat e global-messages-db.sqlite files in order to force Thunderbird and rebuild its index. I am running v 115 though and there's no panacea.dat here. I wonder if there is any new procedure to get the same result... or else, whatever viable solution that could make me recover the former folders structure. of course, the first thing I would do after recovering would be to simplify the structure and/or reorganise in order for the folders to be less heavy, according to any suggestions of yours... that would be more than welcome :) thanks, kind regards

title: Best MBOX to PST Converter?
content:
If you're looking for an MBOX converter, I highly recommend MailsDaddy MBOX to PST Converter. It efficiently converts bulk MBOX files to PST without altering the file structure. Users can filter emails by To, from, date etc. to find and export emails in PST. Additionally, it provides a preview before converting Mbox files, ensuring data integrity. The software supports multiple formats like PST, EML, MSG, RTF, HTML, Office 365, Live Exchange and MHTML .

title: How to access local mails of cancelled IMAP account
content:
Some time ago I switched from provider A to provider B, in both cases with IMAP accounts. I did not copy mails from A to B. After cancelling the contract with A, Thunderbird cannot connect there anymore and asks for the password instead. I assumed I could just deactivate the syncing in the server settings but did not find a way to do that. I also thought that I could still access the mails that were synced before the cancellation but the mail list stays empty.

- How can I make Thunderbird stop from trying to connect to provider A? As far as I saw, I cannot leave the server settings empty. - How can I access my old mails? Can I somehow move or import them to account B?

Thanks!

title: Since update to 128.6.0esr only selective download of emails
content:
Hi there, since the update to 128.6.0esr a few days ago, Thunderbird no longer retrieves all email accounts. In one of the accounts, if I want to download the mails, nothing at all happens.

It no longer even reports in the status bar at the bottom left that it is currently downloading mails. Another account from the same domain, however, can still be downloaded, and shows the retrieval status. As can other accounts.

Even stranger, I can send emails from this account. But I can no longer receive them, even though there are new mails available.

  • Thunderbird 128.6.0esr
  • MacOS 15.2 (24C101)
  • IMAP account, own domain (other account from the same domain can be retrieved, but not this one)
  • Bitdefender antivirus software

I haven't made any changes in the settings, and neither has my provider. I have tried the troubleshooting mode, but I still can't download my mails.

What else can I do? Can you help me?

title: Inoltro messagi PEC, allegati eml annidati
content:
Con l'ultimo aggiornamento, l'inoltro di un messaggio pec (costituito da un messaggio senza corpo e con allegato un file xml ed un file eml) genera un messaggio senza gli allegati del messaggio originale. L'inoltro del messaggio come allegato invece genera correttamente 2 file eml allegati (in realtà annidati l'uno dentro all'altro) ma ha svantaggi nella gestione. Immagino sia sbagliato in generale questo abuso inoltro dei messaggi PEC ma è purtroppo è un comportamento frequente. Vorrei sapere se c'è un modo per ripristinare il comportamento precedente, quando i file eml allegati ad un messaggio PEC erano inoltrati come ogni altro allegato.

Grazie
creator: gianpaolo.pallari

title: Thunderbird
content: Goede middag, Ik heb een probleem/vraag, Ik bezit een desktop windows10 met Thunderbird met 5 mailadressen. Mijn vrouw had een desktop windows10 met 2 van dezelfde mailadressen, haar pc ging ter ziele, we hebben een laptop windows11 aangeschaft en al de data en programma’s (dus ook Thunderbird) van de harde schijf overlaten zetten van haar desktop naar de laptop. Nu is het zo dat ik niet lang meer te leven heb, uitbehandeld van kanker, Aan mijn windpws10 pc heb je na a.s. augustus niet veel meer aan dus is de vraag hoe kan ik het beste mijn accounts, berichten, adresboek en instellingen overzetten naar de laptop. Wat heb ik gedaan? Ik heb geklikt op help / hulp verkrijgen / Installatie en updates Ik kan dan kiezen uit twee mogelijkheden Uw Thunderbird-profiel exporteren Thunderbird-gegevens naar een nieuwe computer verplaatsen De “Een andere alternatieve methode: voor handmatige overdracht tussen Windows 10- en Windows 11-computers” lijkt mij de eenvoudigste methode, klopt dat en als ik dat doe heb ik dan echt de kopie van al mijnwindows10 Thunderbird gegevens op de windows11 laptop staan? Met vriendelijke groet, A Aué

title: Renaming email folder seems to make it disappear from list
content:
After migrating my Windows Live Mail (WLM) 2012 email folders to Thunderbird, I saw that the folder names were truncated and not the same long name I had the folder named in WLM. I have been editing the folder names by copying the WLM folder name to my clipboard and then renaming that truncated folder name in Thunderbird by renaming the folder use the CTRL-V (paste from clipboard).

Prior to today after having done the above, the renamed folder in Thunderbird was moved according to its new alphabetical name in the listing, but usually in the same vicinity of folders that I was renaming. Now, the newly renamed folder seems to disappear from the listing. I scrolled through all of the folders from a to z but couldn't find it. Out of desperation, I closed Thunderbird and then reopend it to see if that would refresh my list of folders with those folders I had just renamed. And, sure enough all of those renamed folders are visible and in the correct alphatical place on the list.

Any guidance or insight would be greatly appreciated!
creator: P38eagle
